section.title: Neutron Features

p.b: How does network separation work and what benefit does it provide?

section.p: Network separation is the name given for the practice of segregation of traffic by types. The primary driver for this is performance and security. Having a dedicated channel enables a network admin to exercise better control over the SLA offered to the tenant. It is often implemented as part of a security policy that is enforced by the security practice in the company.

There are two types of network separation: physical and logical. Both are identical in that they create separate channels for traffic types. For example, a best practice deployment is to create separate channel for storage (iSCSI) traffic. This can be done by creating a logical separation using VLAN on a single NIC or by dedicating a NIC for this type of traffic. In the cloud today, management, tenant, external and services traffic types are segregated into their own channels.

p.b: How does the Multiple-Network feature work?

section.p: Multiple networks is a feature in Helion OpenStack 2.0 that enables bridging of multiple external physical networks to neutron network. Using this functionality a tenant can dictate the path taken by the data in the physical network outside the cloud. It can also be used for multi-homing to two physical networks.
